benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Add tags to invoice item

covered: POST - Valid Payload: Happy-path scenarios for single and multiple tag additions return 201 with Tag objects associated to the invoice item (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC22).
POST - Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON, empty array, null/empty entries, extra fields, invalid tag UUIDs, and missing required header return appropriate 400s (TC06, TC09, TC10, TC11, TC12, TC24).
POST - Validation: Path UUID format validation (400), not-found invoice item (404), and optional headers handling are verified (TC03, TC07, TC08, TC15).
POST - Duplicate Submission/Idempotency behavior: Duplicate UUIDs in the same request and re-adding an existing tag do not create duplicates while still succeeding (TC13, TC20).
POST - Large Payloads: Very large arrays are exercised with expectation of 201 or 413 (TC19).
POST - Server Error Handling: Dependency/service down (503) and timeout (504) scenarios covered (TC17, TC21, TC25).
State variations and limits: Existing tags, no tags, partially populated DB, and maximum tags reached (400) are covered (TC04, TC05, TC22, TC23).
gaps: POST - Server Error Handling: No explicit 500 Internal Server Error scenario (e.g., database failure during tag creation).

Content negotiation/headers: No checks for response Content-Type=application/json on success/errors; no test for unsupported media type (415) when Content-Type is missing/incorrect; no test for Accept header handling (406).
Idempotent retry across requests: No scenario verifying behavior when the exact same POST is retried (e.g., due to client retry) ensuring no duplicate tags and consistent status code.
Authorization breadth: 403 Forbidden (authenticated but insufficient permissions/role) not covered.
Observability/response structure: No schema validation of Tag object fields beyond tagDefinitionId/association (e.g., id, objectType, createdDate) as per definitions/contract.
Headers boundary validation: No tests for overly long or invalid X-Killbill-Reason/Comment values, though optional, to confirm validation rules/limits.
Rate limiting/throttling: High-frequency POSTs behavior not tested (if applicable).
recommendations: Add a scenario to simulate an internal server fault returning 500 (e.g., database failure during insert) and verify proper error payload.
Add content negotiation tests: 1) Missing/incorrect Content-Type returns 415, 2) Unsupported Accept returns 406, and assert Content-Type=application/json in successful/error responses.
Introduce an idempotent retry test: Perform the same POST twice in succession and verify no duplicate tags and expected status semantics (e.g., 201 then 200/201 per API contract).
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated users lacking permission to add tags.
Augment response validation: Validate full Tag schema (required fields, types, and values) and ensure the array contains only the created/existing unique tags.
Add boundary tests for optional headers (Reason/Comment) including max length and disallowed characters, ensuring proper 400 responses when invalid.
If applicable, include a rate limiting test to ensure the API returns appropriate status (e.g., 429) under burst conditions and proper Retry-After headers.
